titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of a certain resolution reported from the Committee on Rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-12, by Mr. Gordon.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 9.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 239 - 155 (Roll no. 27).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/3/1993--Introduced. Waives, with respect to a resolution relating to family and temporary medical leave for certain employees, the requirement for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House.
